## Data Description

This data set contains information about the locations in NYC where individuals can get a flu shot.

```{r}
flu_vax = 
  GET("https://data.cityofnewyork.us/resource/w9ei-idxz.csv") %>% 
  content("parsed")

view(flu_vax)
object.size(flu_vax)
```

Tidy the set

```{r}
flu_vax_tidy = 
  flu_vax %>% 
  select(objectid, facility_name, walk_in, insurance, children, borough, zip_code, latitude, longitude) %>% 
  mutate(borough = str_to_title(borough))
```

Graph it up

```{r}
vax_map = 
  flu_vax_tidy %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = longitude, y = latitude, color = borough)) +
  geom_point()

vax_map
```

Rad. Now do it in `plotly` and add a `leaflet` layer.

```{r, eval= FALSE}
vax_plotly = 
  flu_vax_tidy %>% 
  mutate(text_label = facility_name, "\nZip Code: ", zip_code) %>% 
  plot_ly(
    x = ~longitude, y = ~latitude, color = ~borough,
    text = ~text_label, alpha = 0.7, type = "scatter", mode = "markers"
  ) 

vax_leaf = 
  flu_vax_tidy %>% 
  leaflet() %>% 
  addProviderTiles(providers$CartoDB.Positron) %>% 
  addCircleMarkers(lat = ~latitude, lng = ~longitude, radius = 0.1)

vax_plotly
vax_leaf
```
